title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 December 2008 - XWiki
content:

xwikibot - (02/12/2008 08:46): Drafts.XWikiWebDAV was modified by xwiki:XWiki.asiri - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/XWikiWebDAV  
asyd - (02/12/2008 08:52): heay there  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:10): hi asyd   
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:10): asiri: one question for you  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:10): re the office importer  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:11): do you have a clean class named something like OpenOfficeHTMLCleaner that can be used externally by code?  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:11): in the future I think we'll also need a MicrosoftOfficeHTMLCleaner class  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:12): (that will be needed when importing HTML generated by MSOffice)  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:12): (some users will have Word and will want to do copy/paste)  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:13): (and we should allow them to copypast in the wysiwyg editor for ex and use the office importer code to clean it)  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:13): other question: do you have a clean OfficeImporterSource interface for the input source?  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:14): vmassol: HTML cleaner is not currently part of office importer, i simply use htmlCleaner = (HTMLCleaner) componentManager.lookup(HTMLCleaner.ROLE); clean the html generated by openoffice and apply few filters ... that are openoffice specific ..  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:15): vmassol: The source document is simply a byte[] ... but i beleive you meant something else ...  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:15): is it ?  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:15): asiri: I don't think this is true  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:15): you're doing a lot of cleaning  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:15): yes, through filters ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:15): it doesn't matter what technology you use  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:16): you're doing HTML cleaning  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:16): ok,  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:16): may be we should create a sub package for openoffice specific ones ?  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:16): or .. ?  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:16): so do you have a class that I can use from somewhere else to clean my HTML?  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:16): I want to do this:  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:17): cleaner = lookup(OpenOfficeHTMLCleaner.ROLE)  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:17): cleaner.clean(myhmlt)  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:17): No.  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:17): but it's possible to create one ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:17): I think it would be very useful to have  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:17): and much cleaner ;)  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:17): yes, i agree :)  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:17): and in the future we would add MicrosoftOfficeHTMLCleaner  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:17): so i can put all of those filters together and create a one ..  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:17): with a clean interface ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:18): yes same as the HTMLCleaner  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:18): got it ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:18): (please use the same interface)  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:18): yes, i agree ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:18): so it owuld be:  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:18): lookup(HTMLCleaner.ROLE, "openoffice")  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:18): lookup(HTMLCleaner.ROLE, "microsoft")  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:19): s/microsoft/microsoftoffice/  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:19): so this should go into xwiki-core-xml module ..  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:19): no I think it's fine in the office importer module  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:19): two more cleaners ..  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:19): aha ..  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:19): i see  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 09:19): since it's about office import  
asiri - (02/12/2008 09:20): yes.

asyd - (02/12/2008 15:51): haha, in the google://xwiki syntax/ result page, there is a commercial ad for mindtouch  
vmassol - (02/12/2008 15:52): asyd: yes atlassian and mindtouch are buying ads on xwiki keyword. How nice and fair is this!  
asyd - (02/12/2008 15:55): they should give me their money  
asyd - (02/12/2008 15:56): :)  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:20): hmm, question regarding document name constraint  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:20): when I create a create a document directly using the url, seem there is no problem to use a - in the name  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:20): however, when I use a form, it remove (by javascript I guess) the -  
jvdrean - (02/12/2008 16:24): It's not done via JS but our clearName method might be too restrictive  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:24): do you think there is a problem to use - in the document name? I hope not, I really need it  
jvdrean - (02/12/2008 16:25): no, using - should not be a problem  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:25): I thought in javascript because the name is directly changed into the input text when I click on submit  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:26): ok  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:29): hmm it's in the updatename javascript function  
jvdrean - (02/12/2008 16:30): my bad  
asyd - (02/12/2008 16:30): np

asyd - (02/12/2008 16:42): do you want I fill a jira entry?  
jvdrean - (02/12/2008 16:44): that'd be nice, you should check that there's not an existing one

asiri1 - (02/12/2008 17:56): vmassol: I need to add two pieces of information into Admin guide 1) Recommend using of ssl with webdav 2) How to disable webdav. Where do you think these should fit in ? A separate WebDAV topic may be ?  
vmassol\_\_ - (02/12/2008 17:58): asiri1: yes sounds good  
asiri1 - (02/12/2008 18:00): vmassol: I'll add a topic "Configuring WebDAV (since 1.7)" just after the topic "Configuring the smtp server".  
vmassol\_\_ - (02/12/2008 18:00): ok
